title: "stop feeding" isn't advice
body:
it offers nothing constructive

it is an accusatory statement

it is the equivalent of saying "stop losing my game on purpose", all it serves to do is place blame and inflame people

it is the least helpful pair of words you can say to someone that made a mistake; it is the OPPOSITE of advice.  stating the obvious to someone after a mistake does nothing to help

advice is fine if it relates to play, "max q", "rush zhonya's" etc or if you're watching the lane and can comment on a misplay, , but if you aren't, if you don't know what's happening in the lane, you don't know the magnitude of the mistake and cannot suggest alternatives 

and as a result you need to not comment on it

nothing is more irritating than the 3 man tower dive followed by "omg stop feeding noob" by some clueless schmuck

thanks
